Message:
The Duke finished applying
medicine unto my hands,
before wrapping them
in fresh bandages.

For a samurai to burden
the hands of the one they serve...
’Tis a shame beyond words.

“Shizu. I know how hard
you’ve been training lately,
but I just can’t turn a blind eye
to this kind of recklessness.”

But as I am now,
I have no right to accept it.

“If I’m without my blade,
I’m without any reason
to be here.”

The Duke’s hands stilled
for a brief moment,
then resumed wrapping
the bandages.

For a while onwards,
a heavy silence hung in the air.

After he finished treating
my hands, the Duke spoke.

“Can you see that
tiny flower over there?”

I followed his gaze,
and my eyes came
upon a white flower,
faintly peeking out
from the snow.
